s.text: Here are a few, on a rough spectrum from faith wins to reason wins:
The seen and unseen are independent of each other: You don't read the Bible for answers to scientific questions, and you don't read a biology textbook to find out how to live.
Scientific proofs that contradict biblical stories of the great flood or creation are wrong and have been derived through erroneous means.
The debate over evolution is probably the best-known example of the literalists' combination of rock hard belief and relentless point by point challenge of the rationalist side.
The debate over evolution is probably the best-known example of the literalists' combination of rock hard belief and relentless point by point challenge of the rationalist side.
